title: NexGen Sites Platform Documentation

subsections.title: Welcome to our Web Builder Platform! This tool allows you to create websites easily using a drag-and-drop interface. Here's how to get started:
content: Sign up for an account
Create a new project
Use the left sidebar to add components to your canvas
Customize your components using the right sidebar
Preview your website and export when ready

subsections.title: Navbar
content: The navbar contains the following options:
Logo: Your platform's logo
Home: Return to the main page
Documentation: Access this help guide
About Us: Learn more about our platform
Contact Us: Get in touch with our team
Sign Up: Create a new account

subsections.title: Left Sidebar
content: Contains all the components and elements you can add to your website:
Layout components (Div, Nav, Header, Footer, etc.)
Text elements
Buttons
Links
Icons
Lists
Tables
Media elements (Image, Video, Audio, Map)
Input elements

subsections.title: Canvas Section
content: This is where you build your website by dropping components and elements.

subsections.title: Layers Panel
content: Shows the structure of your website and allows you to select specific elements.

subsections.title: Right Sidebar
content: Used to customize the properties of selected components and elements.

subsections.title: Layout Components
content: Div: A generic container for other elements
Nav: Used for navigation menus
Header: Typically used at the top of a page or section
Footer: Used at the bottom of a page or section
Section: Defines a section in a document
Span: An inline container for text

subsections.title: Text Elements
content: Include headings (H1-H6) and paragraphs for adding text content.

subsections.title: Media Elements
content: Image: Add images to your website
Video: Embed videos in your pages
Audio: Add audio players to your site
Map: Embed interactive maps

subsections.title: Input Elements
content: Various form inputs like text fields, checkboxes, radio buttons, etc.

sections.title: Customizing Your Website
content: Use the right sidebar to customize your components and elements:
Adjust sizes (width, height)
Change colors
Modify fonts and text styles
Add padding and margins
Customize borders
Set background images or colors

sections.title: Managing Pages
content: Create and manage multiple pages for your website:
Click on the "Show Pages" button in the navbar
Use the "+" button to add a new page
Click on a page name to switch between pages
Use the edit icon to rename pages
Use the delete icon to remove pages (cannot delete the last page)

subsections.title: Preview
content: Click the "Preview" button in the navbar to see how your website looks in real-time.

subsections.title: Show Code
content: Click the "Show Code" button to view the generated code for your current page.

subsections.title: Export Project
content: Use the "Export Project" button to download your entire website as a set of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript files.

subsections.title: Create New Project
content: Click "Create New Project" to start a fresh website. You'll have the option to export your current project before creating a new one.

subsections.title: Delete Project
content: Use the "Delete Project" button to remove all data related to your current project. This action cannot be undone.

sections.title: Tips and Tricks
content: Use the layers panel to easily select nested elements
Group related elements inside a Div for easier management
Preview your website frequently to ensure it looks as expected
Use the right sidebar to fine-tune the appearance of your elements
Experiment with different layouts and components to create unique designs

subsections.title: Adding an Image
content: Drag the Image component from the left sidebar onto your canvas
Select the image in the canvas or layers panel
Use the right sidebar to set the image source, alt text, and dimensions
Adjust the image position using drag-and-drop in the canvas

subsections.title: Creating a Navigation Menu
content: Add a Nav component to your canvas
Inside the Nav, add multiple Link components
Customize each link's text and href property in the right sidebar
Style your navigation menu using the properties in the right sidebar

subsections.title: Embedding a Video
content: Drag the Video component onto your canvas
Select the video element
In the right sidebar, set the video source URL
Adjust video properties like autoplay, controls, and dimensions

subsections.title: Creating a Contact Form
content: Add a Form component to your canvas
Inside the Form, add Input components for name, email, and message
Add a Button component for submission
Customize each input field and button using the right sidebar
Set up form submission handling in the advanced settings

conclusion: Remember, practice makes perfect! Don't hesitate to experiment with different components and layouts to create the perfect website for your needs.
